section.title: lms.djangoapps.support.views.certificate module
section.paragraph: Certificate tool in the student support app.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: View
View for viewing and regenerating certificates for users.
This is used by the support team to re-issue certificates to users if something went wrong during the initial certificate generation, such as:

list_item.paragraph: The user’s name was spelled incorrectly.
The user later earned a higher grade and wants it on their certificate and dashboard.

definition_list_item.term: The user accidentally received an honor code certificate because their

definition.paragraph: verification expired before certs were generated.

desc_content.paragraph: Most of the heavy lifting is performed client-side through API calls directly to the certificates app.
Render the certificates support view.
Bases: View
View for viewing and submitting contact us form.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.support.views.course_entitlements module
section.paragraph: Support tool for changing and granting course entitlements

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: View
View for viewing and changing learner enrollments, used by the support team.
Render the enrollment support tool view.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.support.views.course_reset module
section.paragraph: Views for the course reset feature

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: APIView
A view to handle requests related to the course reset feature. GET: List applicable courses, their statuses, and if they can be reset POST: Reset a course for the given learner

List the enrollments for this user that are in courses that have opted into the course reset feature, including information about past resets or resets in progress, and whether or not the reset will be allowed to be done for each returned enrollment

definition_list_item.term: returns a list of dicts with the format [

definition.paragraph: ‘course_id’: <course id> ‘display_name’: <course display name> ‘status’: <status of the enrollment wrt/reset, to be displayed to user> ‘comment’: <comment left by user performing reset. may be blank> ‘can_reset’: (boolean) <can the course be reset for this learner>

desc_content.paragraph: Resets a course for the given learner.

definition.paragraph: course_id (CourseKey): the course to reset comment [optional] (str): 255 characters or fewer comment on why the course is being reset

definition_list_item.term: returns a dicts with the format {

definition.paragraph: ‘course_id’: <course id> ‘display_name’: <course display name> ‘status’: <status of the enrollment wrt/reset, to be displayed to user> ‘comment’: <optional comment made by support staff performing reset> ‘can_reset’: (boolean) <can the course be reset for this learner>

desc_content.paragraph: Args: enrollment (CourseEnrollment) Returns: tuple (boolean, string)

block_quote.paragraph: [0]: whether or not the course can be reset [1]: a status message to present to the learner
or None if there is nothing notable about the enrollment and it can be reset

section.title: lms.djangoapps.support.views.enrollments module
section.paragraph: Support tool for changing course enrollments.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: GenericAPIView
Allows viewing and changing learner enrollments by support staff.
Returns a list of enrollments for the given user, along with information about previous manual enrollment changes.
Returns a list of all modes including expired modes for a given course id

field_body.paragraph: course_id (CourseKey) – Search for course modes for this course.

desc_content.paragraph: For a provided enrollment data dictionary, include order_number from CourseEnrollmentAttribute if available.
From all the attributes of a course enrollment:

list_item.paragraph: Filter order_number attributes namespaced under order

definition_list_item.term: Use the last/latest order number attr if multiple attrs found

list_item.paragraph: This is to keep the usage consistent with get_order_attribute_value method in CourseEnrollment

desc_content.paragraph: For a provided enrollment data dictionary, include source_system from CourseEnrollmentAttribute if available.
From all the attributes of a course enrollment:

list_item.paragraph: Filter source_system attribute namespaced under order

desc_content.paragraph: Add information about the verified mode for the given course_key, if that course has a verified mode.

list_item.paragraph: enrollment_data (dict) – Dictionary representing a single enrollment.
course_key (CourseKey) – The course which this enrollment belongs to.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns serialized information about the manual enrollment belonging to this enrollment, if it exists.

list_item.paragraph: enrollment_data (dict) – Representation of a single course enrollment.
course_key (CourseKey) – The course for this enrollment.

field_body.paragraph: If no manual enrollment change has been made. dict: Serialization of the latest manual enrollment change.

desc_content.paragraph: Allows support staff to alter a user’s enrollment.
Allows support staff to create a user’s enrollment.
Bases: View
View for viewing and changing learner enrollments, used by the support team.
Render the enrollment support tool view.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.support.views.feature_based_enrollments module
section.paragraph: Support tool for viewing course duration information

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: GenericAPIView
Support-only API View for getting feature based enrollment configuration details for a course.
Returns the duration config information if FBE is enabled. If FBE is not enabled, empty dict is returned.
Bases: View
View for listing course duration settings for support team.
Render the course duration tool view.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.support.views.manage_user module
section.paragraph: Support tool for disabling user accounts.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: GenericAPIView
Allows viewing and disabling learner accounts by support staff.
Returns details for the given user, along with information about its username and joining date.
Allows support staff to disable a user’s account.
Bases: View
View for viewing and managing user accounts, used by the support team.
Render the manage user support tool view.
Bases: GenericAPIView
Return most recent and originally verified onboarding exam status for a given user. Return 404 is user not found.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.support.views.program_enrollments module
section.paragraph: Support tool for changing course enrollments.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: APIView
Support-only API View for linking learner enrollments by support staff.
Links learner enrollments by support staff * Example Request:

definition.paragraph: program_uuid: < program_uuid>, username_pair_text: ‘external_user_key,lms_username’ successes: ‘Success messages if Linkages are created’, errors: ‘Error messages if there is no linkages’

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: View
Allows viewing and changing learner enrollments by support staff.
Link the given program enrollments and lms users
Bases: object
A common class to provide functionality of search and display the program enrollments information of a learner for Program Inspector Views and APIViews.
Bases: ProgramEnrollmentInspector, APIView
The APIview to search and display the program enrollments information of a learner.
